name: Obstinate Baloth
text:
When Obstinate Baloth enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Obstinate Baloth, put it onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your graveyard.

name: Obstinate Familiar
text: If you would draw a card, you may skip that draw instead.

editions.flavor:
"Lizards make excellent familiars. They never know when they've lost."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Obzedat, Ghost Council
text:
When Obzedat, Ghost Council enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
At the beginning of your end step, you may exile Obzedat. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of your next upkeep. It gains haste.

name: Obzedat's Aid
text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The Obzedat have revived you with purpose. Don't squander their blessing."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Ocular Halo
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Draw a card."
{W}: Enchanted creature gains vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor: While the soldier dreams, the eyes stand watch.

name: Oculus
text: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Odds
text: Flip a coin. If it comes up heads, counter target instant or sorcery spell. If it comes up tails, copy that spell and you may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Odious Trow
text: {1}{B/G}: Regenerate Odious Trow.

editions.flavor: Trows are the vile trolls that lurk in the bogs of Shadowmoor. They reappear each night to frighten the living and gnaw the dead.

name: Odric, Lunarch Marshal
text: At the beginning of each combat, creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn if a creature you control has first strike. The same is true for flying, deathtouch, double strike, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, reach, skulk, trample, and vigilance.

name: Odric, Master Tactician
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Odric, Master Tactician and at least three other creatures attack, you choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.

editions.flavor: "Fear holds no place in faith's battle plan."

name: Odunos River Trawler
text:
When Odunos River Trawler enters the battlefield, return target enchantment creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{W}, Sacrifice Odunos River Trawler: Return target enchantment creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Odylic Wraith
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Whenever Odylic Wraith deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor: By the time you've seen it, you won't remember that you did.

name: Offalsnout
text:
Flash
When Offalsnout leaves the battlefield, exile target card from a graveyard.
Evoke {B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

name: Off Balance
text: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.

editions.flavor: A heavy weapon deals plenty of damage—but it does have to hit.

name: Offering to Asha
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}. You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"His body belongs to Bant now. His soul? I honestly don't know. I expect it belongs to the angels."
—Rafiq of the Many

name: Ogre Arsonist
text: When Ogre Arsonist enters the battlefield, destroy target land.

editions.flavor:
"All of Ravnica's looking for you, Dack, from the Wojek on down."
—Maytov

name: Ogre Battledriver
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor: Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip.
Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip.
Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip.

name: Ogre Berserker
text: Haste

editions.flavor: The machine does the growling, so the ogre's free to smile.

name: Ogre Enforcer
text: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.

editions.flavor:
"Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command."
—Suka, ogre matron

name: Ogre Gatecrasher
text: When Ogre Gatecrasher enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with defender.

editions.flavor: A popular game among ogres is to see how many revolutions a head can make before it pops off.

name: Ogre Geargrabber
text: Whenever Ogre Geargrabber attacks, gain control of target Equipment an opponent controls until end of turn. Attach it to Ogre Geargrabber. When you lose control of that Equipment, unattach it.

editions.flavor: Long reach, short attention span.

name: Ogre Jailbreaker
text:
Defender
Ogre Jailbreaker can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you control a Gate.

editions.flavor: It took three years for it to occur to him to use the chain as a weapon, but once it did, he made up for lost time.

name: Ogre Leadfoot
text: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.

editions.flavor: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.

name: Ogre Marauder
text: Whenever Ogre Marauder attacks, it gains "Ogre Marauder can't be blocked" until end of turn unless defending player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: Once freed, the oni demanded more and more sacrifices to appease them. The ogres happily obliged.

name: Ogre Menial
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{R}: Ogre Menial gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Ogre Recluse
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, tap Ogre Recluse.

editions.flavor:
"Those ogres who did not embrace oni worship were cast out, cursed, and forced into hermitage, waiting for the day the oni would come for them."
—The History of Kamigawa
He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

name: Ogre Savant
text: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: He's an oxymoron.
He's an oxymoron.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: He's an oxymoron.

name: Ogre's Cleaver
text:
Equipped creature gets +5/+0.
Equip {5}

editions.flavor: She adopted the weapon of the slave-lord Kazuul, and with it, all his cruelty.

name: Ogre Sentry
text: Defender

editions.flavor:
"You have to appreciate the genius of it. Why bother building defenses when you can just fill the pass with angry ogres?"
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

"You have to appreciate the genius of it. Why bother building defenses when you can just fill the pass with angry ogres?"
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Ogre Shaman
text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.
Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.

name: Ogre Slumlord
text:
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may create a 1/1 black Rat creature token.
Rats you control have deathtouch.

editions.flavor:
"His tenement is filled with the most vile, disgusting vermin. It's infested with rats, too."
—Branko One-Ear

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

editions.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.
Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.
Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.
He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.

name: Ohran Viper
text:
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: The ohran viper is not cold-blooded. Its veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.
The ohran viper is not cold-blooded. Its veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.
The ohran viper is not cold-blooded. Its veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.

name: Ohran Yeti
text: {2}{S}: Target snow creature gains first strike until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

editions.flavor: When a snowdrift shows you its eyes, it's already too late.

name: Ojutai Exemplars
text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, choose one —
• Tap target creature.
• Ojutai Exemplars gains first strike and lifelink until end of turn.
• Exile Ojutai Exemplars, then return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

name: Ojutai Interceptor
text:
Flying
Megamorph {3}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "Though I may soar, I could never fly as high as the dragons."

name: Ojutai Monument
text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
{4}{W}{U}: Ojutai Monument becomes a 4/4 white and blue Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Ojutai spends time at all his strongholds, but he most favors Cori Stronghold for his meditation.

name: Ojutai's Breath
text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Ojutai's Command
text:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• You gain 4 life.
• Counter target creature spell.
• Draw a card.

name: Ojutai, Soul of Winter
text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, tap target nonland permanent an opponent controls. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor:
"When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

"When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Ojutai's Summons
text:
Create a 2/2 blue Djinn Monk creature token with flying.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Okiba-Gang Shinobi
text:
Ninjutsu {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Okiba-Gang Shinobi deals combat damage to a player, that player discards two cards.

name: Okina Nightwatch
text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Okina Nightwatch gets +3/+3.

editions.flavor: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.
Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.

name: Okina, Temple to the Grandfathers
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Target legendary creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If a land can be said to have a heart, Okina is the heart of Kamigawa.

name: Okk
text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

name: Old Fogey
text: Phasing, cumulative upkeep {1}, echo, fading 3, bands with other Dinosaurs, protection from Homarids, snow-covered plainswalk, flanking, rampage 2

editions.flavor: "These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's real Magic."

"Beware of trees that talk. Their words are threats. And mind the ones that sway and creak. They too threaten us, but in a foreign tongue."
—The Book of Other Folk

name: Old Man of the Sea
text:
You may choose not to untap Old Man of the Sea during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power for as long as Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and that creature's power remains less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power.

name: Olivia, Mobilized for War
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature, it gains haste until end of turn, and it becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types.

name: Olivia's Bloodsworn
text:
Flying
Olivia's Bloodsworn can't block.
{R}: Target Vampire gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "As we muster for war, I have little patience for lethargy or recalcitrance."

name: Olivia's Dragoon
text: Discard a card: Olivia's Dragoon gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Displays of Voldaren bloodlust are not restricted to glamorous banquets and lavish parties.

name: Olivia Voldaren
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.

name: Oloro, Ageless Ascetic
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life.
Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card and each opponent loses 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Oloro, Ageless Ascetic is in the command zone, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Last to charge, last to fall.

name: Omen
text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

name: Omen Machine
text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a land card, the player puts it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, the player casts it without paying its mana cost if able.

name: Omen of Fire
text:
Return all Islands to their owners' hands.
Each player sacrifices a Plains or a white permanent for each white permanent he or she controls.

editions.flavor:
"Let Balduvia burn to warm Kjeldor's hearth!"
—General Varchild

name: Omenspeaker
text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

editions.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

name: Omnath, Locus of Mana
text:
Green mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.
Omnath, Locus of Mana gets +1/+1 for each green mana in your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It gathers against the coming storm.
It gathers against the coming storm.

name: Omnath, Locus of Rage
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 5/5 red and green Elemental creature token.
Whenever Omnath, Locus of Rage or another Elemental you control dies, Omnath deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Omnibian
text: {T}: Target creature becomes a Frog with base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"This creature has hyperevolved chameleonic abilities. It no longer mimics its surroundings, instead forcing them to take on its form."
—Simic research notes

name: Omniscience
text: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.

editions.flavor:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren

text:
O-Naginata can be attached only to a creature with power 3 or greater.
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample.

text:
All creatures are black and have deathtouch.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

name: Once More with Feeling
text:
Remove Once More with Feeling from the game as well as all cards in play and in all graveyards. Each player shuffles his or her hand into her or his library, then draws seven cards. Each player's life total is set to 10.

name: Ondu Cleric
text: Whenever Ondu Cleric or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain life equal to the number of Allies you control.

editions.flavor: A cleric's true balm is the confidence he inspires in his compatriots.

text:

Defender

editions.flavor: Farmhands and priests mutter curses at the ragged thing; it unnerves more than just the crows.

name: One of the Pack
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform One of the Pack.

editions.flavor: When the howl beckons, he cannot resist the urge to join the others.

Enchant creature

Enchant creature

text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

text:
Flying

text:
Flying

Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

Flying
